metadata.title: USN-5193-1 -- X.Org X Server vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Jan-Niklas Sohn discovered that the X.Org X Server incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code and escalate privileges.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5193-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xwayland - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xorg-server-source - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xserver-xephyr - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xdmx - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xserver-xorg-dev - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xvfb - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xnest - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xserver-common - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 xdmx-tools - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10 No subscription required  xorg-server-source-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.6 xserver-xorg-dev-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.6 xserver-xephyr-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.6 xserver-xorg-legacy-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.6 xwayland-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.6 xserver-xorg-core-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.6 No subscription required
